page.title: 15PIER ARTS CENTRE
page.content: The house fronting the street was built in the 18th century on a pier.It was turned into an arts centre in 1979.There are seven exhibition rooms and outside there is a sculpture built in 1956 by Barbara Hepworth.The centre is open all year round and it is free of charge.They get many tourists in July and August, the busiest times of the year.There are mixed exhibitions but mostly visual arts,painting, drawing,sculpture etc.In summer they have a room in which children can go and paint or draw etc.Local artists are Stanley Cursiter,Marian Ashburn, Syliva Wishart,Gunnie Moberg and many more.The most popular exhibitions are Open Week & Xmas exhibition.The talks by poets or authors etc are good but only small groups of people turn up ,usually about 30-40 people.
